item.title: Rounding in tibbles and pillar
item.description: Tibble column chopping is a thing https://twitter.com/dataandme/status/956316981690585090 I got a question from yup Chenzi Xu chenzi.xu@seh.ox.ac.uk Issue: https://github.com/r-lib/pillar/issues/93 There are good options for controlling these https://www.tidyverse.org/articles/2018/01/tibble-1-4-2/?utm_content=buffer418b3&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer But should there be an option for turning off rounding? library("tidyverse") ## ── Attaching packages ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.2.4 ## ✔ tibble 1.4.2 ✔ dplyr 0.7.4 ## ✔ tidyr 0.8.0 ✔ stringr 1.2.0 ## ✔ readr 1.1.1 ✔ forcats 0.
